private_information: Ronald has no meetings on Monday and is free between 09:00 and 17:00.
ronald.goal: Find a 30 minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

private_information: Stephen is busy on Monday 10:00-10:30 and 12:00-12:30.
stephen.goal: Find a 30 minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

brittany.goal: Find a 30 minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

rebecca.goal: Find a 30 minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

jordan.goal: Find a 30 minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that encodes the scheduling problem and returns a valid 30 minute meeting slot for all participants.

public_information: We need to schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
All participants must attend: Ronald, Stephen, Brittany, Dorothy, Rebecca, Jordan.
A valid solution exists that fits everyone's existing schedule.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are participant Ronald. Given your private schedule and the environment work hours, provide your free time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Return a JSON list of availability intervals with start and end times in HH:MM format under the key availabilities.

You are participant Stephen. Given your private schedule and the environment work hours, provide your free time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Return a JSON list of availability intervals with start and end times in HH:MM format under the key availabilities.

You are participant Brittany. Given your private schedule and the environment work hours, provide your free time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Return a JSON list of availability intervals with start and end times in HH:MM format under the key availabilities.

You are participant Dorothy. Given your private schedule and the environment work hours, provide your free time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Return a JSON list of availability intervals with start and end times in HH:MM format under the key availabilities.

You are participant Rebecca. Given your private schedule and the environment work hours, provide your free time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Return a JSON list of availability intervals with start and end times in HH:MM format under the key availabilities.

You are participant Jordan. Given your private schedule and the environment work hours, provide your free time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Return a JSON list of availability intervals with start and end times in HH:MM format under the key availabilities.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive each participant availability and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the scheduling problem for a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Target the FastDownwards solver when designing the problem and include any necessary temporal discretization. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep each participant action or resource distinct and ensure the produced PDDL allows finding at least one valid meeting start time that fits all availabilities.
